info.title: Customers API
info.description:
To learn more about Customers see [here](/api-docs/customers/customers-subscribers-overview). 
### Customers
Identity and account details for customers shopping on BigCommerce stores.

### Customer Addresses
Postal address belonging to a customer.

### Customer Groups
Groupings of customers who share the same level of access and discounts at a store.

get.description: Returns a list of all *Customers*. Default sorting is by customer id, from lowest to highest. Optional parameters can be passed in.

id.description: Unique numeric ID of this customer. This is a READ-ONLY field; do not set or modify its value in a POST or PUT request.

_authentication.description: Not returned in any responses, but accepts up to two fields allowing you to set the customer’s password. If a password is not supplied, it is generated automatically. For further information about using this object, please see the Customers resource documentation.

company.description: The name of the company for which the customer works.

date_created.description: Date on which the customer registered from the storefront or was created in the control panel. This is a READ-ONLY field; do not set or modify its value in a POST or PUT request.

date_modified.description: Date on which the customer updated their details in the storefront or was updated in the control panel. This is a READ-ONLY field; do not set or modify its value in a POST or PUT request.

store_credit.description: The amount of credit the customer has. (Float, Float as String, Integer)

registration_ip_address.description: The customer’s IP address when they signed up.

customer_group_id.description: The group to which the customer belongs.

tax_exempt_category.description: Used to identify customers who fall into special sales-tax categories – in particular, those who are fully or partially exempt from paying sales tax. Can be blank, or can contain a single AvaTax code. (The codes are case-sensitive.) Stores that subscribe to BigCommerce’s Avalara Premium integration will use this code to determine how/whether to apply sales tax. Does not affect sales-tax calculations for stores that do not subscribe to Avalara Premium.

accepts_marketing.description: If the customer accepts product review emails or abandon cart emails. Read-Only.

url.description: Full URL of where the resource is located.

form_fields.description: Array of custom fields. This is a READ-ONLY field; do not set or modify its value in a POST or PUT request.

reset_pass_on_login.description: Force a password change on next login.

x-unitTests.x-testDescription:
Gets the collection of customers. (Default sorting is by customer id, from lowest to highest.)
This request can be filtered by any of the _Customer_ object properties except form fields.

post.description:
Creates a *Customer*.

**Required Fields**
*   first_name
*   last_name
*   email

**Read Only Fields**
*   id
*   date_created
*   date_modified
*   accepts_marketing
*   addresses
*   form_fields

## Notes 

The `_authentication` object exposes functionality associated with the customer’s ability to log in to the store. All properties of the `_authentication` object are optional.

When the `_authentication` object is not supplied with an update request, then the existing customer password remains the same.

## Updating Passwords 

To manually update a customer password in the same way as the control panel, supply a value for the password field:

```
{
    "_authentication": {
        "password": "12w69Y217PYR96J"
    }
}
```

## Confirming Passwords 

An additional optional `password_confirmation` field can also be sent, providing password confirmation as a service:

```
{
    "_authentication": {
       "password": "12w69Y217PYR96J",
       "password_confirmation": "12w69Y217PYR96J"
    }
}
```

## Forcing Password Resets 

To force a customer to reset their password upon their next login attempt, give the `force_reset` field a value of true, as shown here:

```
{
    "_authentication": {
        "force_reset": true
    }
}

_authentication.description: This can vary depending on the action being taken to update, validate or force a password change. See Update Customer

delete.description: By default, it deletes all *Customers*. Up to 100 customers per batch can be deleted.

x-unitTests.x-testDescription: Gets a count of the total number of customers in the store.

password.description: String to run against customer password. Will return a true or false.

get.description:
Returns a list of *Customer Addresses*. Returns the addresses belonging to a customer. Default sorting is by address id, from lowest to highest. 

The maximum limit is 250. If a limit isn’t provided, up to 50 `customer_addresses` are returned by default.

id.description: ID of this customer address. READ-ONLY

state.description: The customer’s state/province. Do not abbreviate the state; spell out the entire word, e.g.: California. (Cannot be null. As a workaround for addresses that include no state/province string, pass a space as the “state” value.)

zip.description: The customer’s ZIP or postal code.

country.description: The customer’s country. Must be the full country name.

country_iso2.description: 2-letter ISO Alpha-2 code for the customer’s country. READ-ONLY

post.description:
Creates a new *Customer Address*. (Note: The “state” property cannot be null. As a workaround for addresses that include no state/province string, pass a space as the “state” value.)

**Required Fields**
*   first_name
*   last_name
*   phone
*   street_1
*   city
*   state
*   zip
*   country

**Read Only Fields**
*   id
*   country_iso2

id.description: ID of this customer address. READ-ONLY

state.description: The customer’s state/province. Do not abbreviate the state; spell out the entire word, e.g.: California. (Cannot be null. As a workaround for addresses that include no state/province string, pass a space as the “state” value.)

zip.description: The customer’s ZIP or postal code.

country.description: The customer’s country. Must be the full country name.

country_iso2.description: 2-letter ISO Alpha-2 code for the customer’s country. READ-ONLY

zip.description: The customer’s ZIP or postal code.

country.description: The customer’s country. Must be the full country name.

country_iso2.description: 2-letter ISO Alpha-2 code for the customer’s country. READ-ONLY

country_iso2.description: 2-letter ISO Alpha-2 code for the customer’s country. READ-ONLY

get.description: Returns a count of addresses for a customer.
get.summary: Get A Count of Customer Addresses

get.description: Returns a list of *Customer Groups*. Default sorting is by customer-group id, from lowest to highest.

parameters.name: name
parameters.description: Filter customer groups by exact name match. Can use `name:like` to filter using a fuzzy matching method. This is good for implementing search.

parameters.name: is_default
parameters.description: If customers who signup are added to this group by default

delete.description:
By default, it deletes all *Customer Groups*. 

All existing customers are unassigned from the group when it is deleted.

parameters.name: is_default
parameters.description: If customers who signup are added to this group by default

delete.description:
Deletes a *Customer Group*. 

**Notes**

All existing customers are unassigned from the group when it is deleted.

parameters.name: customer_group_id
parameters.description: The id of the customer group.

put.description:
Updates a *Customer Group*.

**Notes**

Any combination of fields can be updated at once. Discount rules are treated in bulk. The entire set of rules is overwritten when a request is sent.

get.description: Returns a count of all *Customer Groups*.
get.summary: Get a Count of Customer Groups

url.description: URL of the shipping address for api requests

type.description:
+ `all` - Customers can access all categories
 + `specific`  - Customers can access a specific list of categories
+ `none` - Customers are prevented from viewing any of the categories in this group.

categories.description: Is an array of category IDs and should be supplied only if `type` is specific.

url.description: Full URL of where the resource is located.

id.description: ID of this customer address. READ-ONLY

state.description: The customer’s state/province. Do not abbreviate the state; spell out the entire word, e.g.: California. (Cannot be null. As a workaround for addresses that include no state/province string, pass a space as the “state” value.)

zip.description: The customer’s ZIP or postal code.

country.description: The customer’s country. Must be the full country name.

country_iso2.description: 2-letter ISO Alpha-2 code for the customer’s country. READ-ONLY

CustomerGroup.title: Customer Group
CustomerGroup.description: When creating a customer group category discount using the API it defaults to "products in this category and its subcategories". In the [Control Panel](https://support.bigcommerce.com/s/article/Customer-Groups#pricing) this can be changed to either "products in this category only" or "products in this category and its subcategories". There are currently no settings to change this behavior via API.

is_default.description: Determines whether new customers are assigned to this group by default.

discount_rules.description: A collection of discount rules that are automatically applied to customers who are members of the group

amount.description: A float that specifies the value applied to the price modified

price_list_id.description: If a customer group is assigned to a price list,`method` and `amount` are not shown. `type` and `price_list_id` are returned.

is_group_for_guests.description: If the groups is for guests. There can only be one customer group for guests at a time.

country_id.description: Numeric ID of the state’s/province’s associated country.

CustomerGroupPost.title: Customer Group
CustomerGroupPost.description: When creating a customer group category discount using the API it defaults to "products in this category and its subcategories". In the [Control Panel](https://support.bigcommerce.com/s/article/Customer-Groups#pricing) this can be changed to either "products in this category only" or "products in this category and its subcategories". There are currently no settings to change this behavior via API.

is_default.description: Determines whether new customers are assigned to this group by default.

discount_rules.description: A collection of discount rules that are automatically applied to customers who are members of the group

amount.description: A float that specifies the value applied to the price modified

price_list_id.description: If a customer group is assigned to a price list,`method` and `amount` are not shown. `type` and `price_list_id` are returned.

is_group_for_guests.description: If the groups is for guests. There can only be one customer group for guests at a time.

is_group_for_guests.name: is_group_for_guests
is_group_for_guests.description: If the groups is for guests. There can only be one customer group for guests at a time.
